members.name: id
members.doc: WixMedia image ID. Required.

members.name: url
members.doc: Image URL.

members.name: height
members.doc: Original image height. Required.

members.name: width
members.doc: Original image width. Required.

members.name: altText
members.doc: Image alt text.

members.name: filename
members.doc: Image filename.

members.name: id
members.doc: WixMedia ID. Required when associating an existing Wix Media video.

members.name: url
members.doc: Video URL. Required when associating a video from an external source (YouTube/Vimeo).

members.name: resolutions
members.doc: Available resolutions for the video, starting with the optimal resolution.

members.name: filename
members.doc: Video filename.

members.name: posters
members.doc: Video posters.

members.name: url
members.doc: Video URL.  Required.

members.name: height
members.doc: Video height. Required.

members.name: width
members.doc: Video width.  Required.

members.name: format
members.doc: Video format for example, mp4, hls.  Required.

members.name: quality
members.doc: Video quality for example 480p, 720p.

members.name: filename
members.doc: Video filename.

members.name: imageInfo
members.doc: Image info - Wix Media Image. Required.

members.name: focalPoint
members.doc: Focal point of the image.

members.name: exif
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs describing the media in [Exchangeable Image File format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exif).

members.name: quality
members.doc:
Image compression level.
Min: `30`
Max: `100`

members.name: unsharpMasking
members.doc: [Unsharp masking](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unsharp_masking) values of the image.

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Unsharp masking amount. Controls the sharpening strength.
Min: `0`
Max: `5`

members.name: radius
members.doc: Unsharp masking radius in pixels. Controls the sharpening width.

members.name: threshold
members.doc:
Unsharp masking threshold. Controls how different neighboring pixels must be for shapening to apply.
Min: `0`
Max: `1`

members.name: x
members.doc: X-coordinate of the focal point.

members.name: y
members.doc: Y-coordinate of the focal point.

members.name: videoInfo
members.doc: Video info - can include Wix Media or an external link from YouTube or Vimeo. Required.

members.name: durationInMillis
members.doc: Manually defined Video duration in milliseconds.

members.name: projectId
members.doc:
Id of the Project the items are part of
Project must exist before adding items to it. project can be created/updated/deleted using this //TODO
 TODO: add (.wix.api.format) = GUID after used

members.name: id
members.doc: Item ID.

members.name: sortOrder
members.doc:
Item sort order. Determines which position a media item is displayed in the gallery.
Min: `1`
Default: [Epoch](https://www.epoch101.com/) timestamp in descending order (end of the gallery items list).
*Note:** If the same sort order number is assigned to more than one media item in a gallery, the first media item to which it was assigned will come first.

members.name: title
members.doc: Item title.

members.name: description
members.doc: Item description.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Item data type. One of:
+`"IMAGE"`
+`"VIDEO"`
+`"TEXT"`

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the item was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the item was last updated.

members.name: tags
members.doc: Item tags.

members.name: image
members.doc: Information about the image.

members.name: video
members.doc: Information about the video.

members.name: values
members.doc: List of tags assigned to the media item.

members.name: totalSuccesses
members.doc: Number of items that were successfully processed.

members.name: totalFailures
members.doc: Number of items that couldn't be processed.

members.name: undetailedFailures
members.doc: Number of failures without details because detailed failure threshold was exceeded.

members.name: id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
 Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
 For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
 NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
 For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
  it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
 As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
 To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
  message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: The AppDefId

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: The instance Id

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the page is on

members.name: pageId
members.doc: Invalidate by Page ID

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the URI is on

members.name: uriPath
members.doc: URI path to invalidate (e.g. page/my/path) - without leading/trailing slashes

members.name: reason
members.doc:
tell us why you're invalidating the cache. You don't need to add your app name
 The cache invalidation reason

members.name: localDc
members.doc: Is local DS

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: Invalidate by msId. NOT recommended, as this will invalidate the entire site cache!

members.name: siteId
members.doc: Invalidate by Site ID. NOT recommended, as this will invalidate the entire site cache!

members.name: app
members.doc: Invalidate by App

members.name: page
members.doc: Invalidate by page id

members.name: uri
members.doc: Invalidate by URI path

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:  
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • WIX_MEDIA
  • EXTERNAL
